intro: Cochlearia diversifolia, commonly known as the variable cochlearia, is a flowering plant native to the British Isles. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many species of mustard and related plants. The plant is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and clusters of small, white, four-petaled flowers. It typically grows in coastal or maritime environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. Cochlearia diversifolia is often found in habitats such as dunes, cliffs, and coastal grasslands.
